result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Yvonne Kytola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Petty Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Yvonne Kytola

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Walmart in New Richmond, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten via zoom, Clerk: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Scott Selmer for purposes of today only  DF:  Devon Yvonne Kytola appeared. DE did not contact PD. Address and DOB confirmed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Court reserves on all pre plea rights. Court reviews right to counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
